labels.label:
When the output reaches here, we now have a flattened JSON, and we can do whatever we need. Write to Kafka, HDFS, Hive etc..
{ "location" : "51.5017398,-0.1386134", "address" : "Westminster, London, SW1A 0AA", "landline" : "020 7219 4272", "amount" : "10", "currency" : "GBP", "ts" : "2019-08-16 23:54:59.682761" }

entry.value: select RPATH(transaction, '/GEO/location') as location, RPATH(transaction, '/GEO/address') as address, RPATH(transaction, '/GEO/landline') as landline, RPATH(transaction, '/amount') as amount, RPATH(transaction, '/currency') as currency, RPATH(transaction, '/ts') as ts from FLOWFILE
